item.title: System loads and shutdown timeout
item.description: Here is a memo to make a Linux system run and shutdown smoothly and quickly. Ruducing system loads I have edited Settings -> Search menu to disable background jobs. Currently, I disabled everything. This seems to reduce CPU loads from the following process names: tracker-miner-fs-3 about 5-8% tracker-extract-3 about 3-5% Quick workaround for timeout https://itsfoss.com/long-shutdown-linux/ Edit /etc/systemd/system.conf to reduce timeout from default 100s according to systemd-system.conf(5): DefaultTimeoutStartSec=, DefaultTimeoutStopSec=, DefaultTimeoutAbortSec=, DefaultRestartSec= Configures the default timeouts for starting, stopping and aborting of units, as well as the default time to sleep between automatic restarts of units, as configured per-unit in TimeoutStartSec=, TimeoutStopSec=, TimeoutAbortSec= and RestartSec= (for services, see systemd.
